cs3500.music.model

Class JMidiEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs3500.music.model.JMidiEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IjMidiEvent

    public class JMidiEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements IjMidiEvent
    The class Represents a midi event inside a MIDI track. This events usually represent NOTES but sometimes will also represent other events in the composition, such as not-NOTE related events like percussive instructions. For further expansion once the keyboard view is finished, I decided to keep the technical term. - The J prefix is used to avoid overriding the java midi class MidiEvent.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  JMidiEvent.Builder
      the class Builds a cs3500.music.model.JMidiEvent according to the default values or the ones directed by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static JMidiEvent.Builder builder()
        starts a builder for its construction.

      • getTick

        public int getTick()
        Retrieves the tick of the event. - A 'Tick' the standard measure we will use to store note changes, this changes will then be synchronized with the actual tempo of a composition. A tick is fixed to represent 120 BPM.
        Specified by:
        getTick in interface IjMidiEvent

      • getPitch

        public int getPitch()
        Retrieves the absolute pitch of the event. This pitch doe not take the octave ina count, this will be handled by the assigned virtual instrument in the track.
        Specified by:
        getPitch in interface IjMidiEvent
